mappings.name: Get a spell by index.

casting_time.description: How long it takes for the spell to activate.

classes.description: List of classes that are able to learn the spell.

components.description:
List of shorthand for required components of the spell.
V: verbal
S: somatic
M: material

concentration.description: Determines if a spell needs concentration to persist.

duration.description: How long the spell effect lasts.

higher_level.description: List of descriptions for casting the spell at higher levels.

material.description: Material component for the spell to be cast.

range.description: Range of the spell, usually expressed in feet.

ritual.description: Determines if a spell can be cast in a 10-min(in-game) ritual.

subclasses.description: List of subclasses that have access to the spell.

subsections.description: List of sections for each subheading underneath the rule in the SRD.

mappings.name: Get a rule section by index.

response.body:
{
  "desc" : "## Time

In situations where keeping track of the passage of time is important, the GM determines the time a task requires. The GM might use a different time scale depending on the context of the situation at hand. In a dungeon environment, the adventurers' movement happens on a scale of **minutes**. It takes them about a minute to creep down a long hallway, another minute to check for traps on the door at the end of the hall, and a good ten minutes to search the chamber beyond for anything interesting or valuable.

In a city or wilderness, a scale of **hours** is often more appropriate. Adventurers eager to reach the lonely tower at the heart of the forest hurry across those fifteen miles in just under four hours' time.

For long journeys, a scale of **days** works best.

Following the road from Baldur's Gate to Waterdeep, the adventurers spend four uneventful days before a goblin ambush interrupts their journey.

In combat and other fast-paced situations, the game relies on **rounds**, a 6-second span of time.
",
  "index" : "time",
  "name" : "Time",
  "url" : "/api/rule-sections/time"
}

mappings.name: Get traits available for a race.
Get subraces available for a race.

Get a race by index.

age.description: Flavor description of possible ages for this race.

alignment.description: Flavor description of likely alignments this race takes.

language_desc.description: Flavor description of the languages this race knows.

languages.description: Starting languages for all new characters of this race.

size_description.description: Flavor description of height and weight for this race.

speed.description: Base move speed for this race (in feet per round).

starting_proficiencies.description: Starting proficiencies for all new characters of this race.

subraces.description: All possible subraces that this race includes.

traits.description: Racial traits that provide benefits to its members.

mappings.name: Get a proficiency by index.

classes.description: Classes that start with this proficiency.

races.description: Races that start with this proficiency.

reference.description: `APIReference` to the full description of the related resource.

type.description: The general category of the proficiency.

mappings.name: Get monster by index.

charisma.description: A monster's ability to charm or intimidate a player.

dexterity.description: The monster's ability for swift movement or stealth

intelligence.description: The monster's ability to outsmart a player.

strength.description: How hard a monster can hit a player.

wisdom.description: A monster's ability to ascertain the player's plan.

actions.description: A list of actions that are available to the monster to take during combat.

items.description: Action available to a `Monster` in addition to the standard creature actions.
Damage type and dice associated with a particular attack.

alignments.description: A creature's general moral and personal attitudes.

armor_class.description: The difficulty for a player to successfully deal damage to a monster.

items.description: The armor class of a monster.

challenge_rating.description: A monster's challenge rating is a guideline number that says when a monster becomes an appropriate challenge against the party's average level. For example. A group of 4 players with an average level of 4 would have an appropriate combat challenge against a monster with a challenge rating of 4 but a monster with a challenge rating of 8 against the same group of players would pose a significant threat.

condition_immunities.description: A list of conditions that a monster is immune to.

damage_immunities.description: A list of damage types that a monster will take double damage from.

damage_resistances.description: A list of damage types that a monster will take half damage from.

damage_vulnerabilities.description: A list of damage types that a monster will take double damage from.

forms.description: List of other related monster entries that are of the same form. Only applicable to Lycanthropes that have multiple forms.

hit_dice.description: The hit die of a monster can be used to make a version of the same monster whose hit points are determined by the roll of the die. For example: A monster with 2d6 would have its hit points determine by rolling a 6 sided die twice.

hit_points.description: The hit points of a monster determine how much damage it is able to take before it can be defeated.

hit_points_roll.description: The roll for determining a monster's hit points, which consists of the hit dice (e.g. 18d10) and the modifier determined by its Constitution (e.g. +36). For example, 18d10+36

image.description: The image url of the monster.

languages.description: The languages a monster is able to speak.

legendary_actions.description: A list of legendary actions that are available to the monster to take during combat.

proficiencies.description: A list of proficiencies of a monster.

reactions.description: A list of reactions that is available to the monster to take during combat.

blindsight.description: A monster with blindsight can perceive its surroundings without relying on sight, within a specific radius.

darkvision.description: A monster with darkvision can see in the dark within a specific radius.

tremorsense.description: A monster with tremorsense can detect and pinpoint the origin of vibrations within a specific radius, provided that the monster and the source of the vibrations are in contact with the same ground or substance.

truesight.description: A monster with truesight can, out to a specific range, see in normal and magical darkness, see invisible creatures and objects, automatically detect visual illusions and succeed on saving throws against them, and perceive the original form of a shapechanger or a creature that is transformed by magic. Furthermore, the monster can see into the Ethereal Plane within the same range.

senses.description: Monsters typically have a passive perception but they might also have other senses to detect players.

size.description: The size of the monster ranging from Tiny to Gargantuan."

special_abilities.description: A list of the monster's special abilities.

speed.description: Speed for a monster determines how fast it can move per turn.

burrow.description: A monster that has a burrowing speed can use that speed to move through sand, earth, mud, or ice. A monster can’t burrow through solid rock unless it has a special trait that allows it to do so.

climb.description: A monster that has a climbing speed can use all or part of its movement to move on vertical surfaces. The monster doesn’t need to spend extra movement to climb.

fly.description: A monster that has a flying speed can use all or part of its movement to fly.

swim.description: A monster that has a swimming speed doesn’t need to spend extra movement to swim.

walk.description: All creatures have a walking speed, simply called the monster’s speed. Creatures that have no form of ground-based locomotion have a walking speed of 0 feet.

subtype.description: The sub-category of a monster used for classification of monsters."

xp.description: The number of experience points (XP) a monster is worth is based on its challenge rating.

response.body:
{
  "desc" : "Elvish is fluid, with subtle intonations and intricate grammar. Elven literature is rich and varied, and their songs and poems are famous among other races. Many bards learn their language so they can add Elvish ballads to their repertoires.",
  "index" : "elvish",
  "name" : "Elvish",
  "script" : "Elvish",
  "type" : "Standard",
  "typical_speakers" : [ "Elves" ],
  "url" : "/api/languages/elvish"
}
